title: Biden Order Mandates Union Pacts for Federal Projects Over $35 Million
sub_head: Project labor agreements, covering everything from pay, workplace conditions to worker qualifications, will raise wages and training standards, White House says
body:
WASHINGTONâ€”President Biden signed an executive order on Friday mandating that the government enter into agreements with labor unions setting pay and conditions for federal construction projects that cost more than $35 million.
The White House said the wider use of project labor agreements would ease coordination challenges on large construction projects, and raise wages and training standards for workers.
